T0.title: Test Infrastructure Foundation
T0.description: Set up test infrastructure including docker-compose with PostgreSQL, test database schema, and logging utilities.
acceptance_criteria: docker-compose.yml runs PostgreSQL 15 locally
Test database auto-initializes with schema on startup
Custom test logger with detailed logging (timestamp, context, trace IDs)
Test data seeding utilities with realistic sample data
Clean slate utilities between test runs
npm run test:infrastructure starts and stops cleanly
subtasks: T0.1: Create docker-compose.yml with PostgreSQL 15, Redis (for future), and test data seeding
T0.2: Create test/database/setup.ts with connection pooling for test environment
T0.3: Create test/database/seed.ts with helpers for creating realistic supporter data, events, memberships
T0.4: Create test/utils/logger.ts with structured logging (timestamp, level, context, trace_id, test_name)
T0.5: Create test/fixtures/ directory with JSON fixtures for test data (supporters, events, webhooks)
T0.6: Add npm scripts: test:unit, test:integration, test:e2e, test:infrastructure, test:clean

T1.title: Repository Layer Real Unit Tests
T1.description: Create real unit tests for repository layer against actual PostgreSQL test database. NO MOCKS. Tests verify SQL queries, transactions, constraints, and edge cases.
acceptance_criteria: supporter.repository.real.test.ts - 100% coverage of CRUD operations
event.repository.real.test.ts - 100% coverage of event storage and timeline queries
membership.repository.real.test.ts - 100% coverage of membership logic
All tests use real PostgreSQL connection (not mocked)
Tests verify actual SQL execution via query inspection
Transaction rollback tests verify data integrity
Edge cases: NULL handling, empty results, constraint violations, concurrent updates
subtasks: T1.1: SupporterRepository - test create(), findById(), search(), merge(), email aliases, linked IDs
T1.2: EventRepository - test create(), findByExternalId(), getTimeline(), filter options, date ranges
T1.3: MembershipRepository - test upsert(), getStatus(), paid_up calculation, tier logic
T1.4: Transaction tests - test rollback on error, concurrent updates, isolation levels
T1.5: Performance tests - verify query performance with large datasets, add indexes if needed

T2.title: API Handler Integration Tests
T2.description: Create integration tests for API handlers connecting to real database, repositories, and auth middleware. Tests HTTP request/response cycle with detailed logging.
acceptance_criteria: search.handler.integration.test.ts - query parsing, filtering, pagination, error responses
profile.handler.integration.test.ts - profile retrieval, not found cases, data aggregation
timeline.handler.integration.test.ts - timeline filtering, pagination, date grouping
merge.handler.integration.test.ts - merge validation, conflict detection, audit logging
All tests use real repositories and database (no mocks except external services)
Request/response logging with trace IDs for debugging
Auth middleware integration tests
subtasks: T2.1: Create test/setup/api-handler.ts with test API Gateway event builder and response validator
T2.2: Search handler tests - query validation, field search, type filters, limit/offset, edge cases
T2.3: Profile handler tests - full profile aggregation, overview cards, linked accounts, flags
T2.4: Timeline handler tests - event retrieval, type filtering, date range, pagination, metadata
T2.5: Merge handler tests - validation, conflict detection, atomic merge, audit log creation, rollback scenarios

T3.title: Webhook Handler Integration Tests
T3.description: Create integration tests for webhook handlers verifying signature validation, JSON parsing, S3 storage, SQS queuing, and error handling with detailed logging.
acceptance_criteria: stripe.handler.integration.test.ts - signature verification, payload parsing, S3 upload, SQS send
shopify.handler.integration.test.ts - HMAC verification, topic handling, multi-event processing
gocardless.handler.integration.test.ts - signature validation, events array, individual SQS messages
mailchimp.handler.integration.test.ts - form data parsing, click events, data field JSON parsing
Tests use real SQS client (LocalStack or mocked at AWS SDK level), real S3 client (LocalStack)
Signature verification tests with valid/invalid/tampered signatures
Error scenarios: malformed JSON, missing headers, signature failures, S3/SQS errors
Detailed request/response logging with trace IDs
subtasks: T3.1: Create test/setup/webhook.ts with webhook event builders for all providers
T3.2: Create test/utils/signature.ts with signature generation helpers for testing
T3.3: Stripe webhook tests - valid signature, invalid signature, missing signature, malformed JSON, S3 success/failure, SQS success/failure
T3.4: Shopify webhook tests - valid HMAC, invalid HMAC, missing topic header, multiple events
T3.5: GoCardless webhook tests - signature validation, events array processing, empty events
T3.6: Mailchimp webhook tests - form parsing, JSON data field parsing, click events

T4.title: Processor Integration Tests
T4.description: Create integration tests for event processors verifying end-to-end data flow from SQS message to database storage, with S3 raw payload retrieval and detailed logging.
acceptance_criteria: stripe.processor.integration.test.ts - SQS to DB flow, S3 payload retrieval, membership creation
shopify.processor.integration.test.ts - order processing, supporter matching, event creation
gocardless.processor.integration.test.ts - subscription handling, membership updates, payment tracking
futureticketing.processor.integration.test.ts - ticket events, supporter matching, stadium entry
mailchimp.processor.integration.test.ts - click events, tag updates, email matching
Tests use real SQS (LocalStack), real S3, real PostgreSQL
Full data flow verification: SQS → processor → DB → verify DB state
Error handling: DLQ scenarios, retry logic, partial failures
Detailed logging at each processing step
subtasks: T4.1: Create test/setup/processor.ts with SQS message builders and S3 mock setup
T4.2: Stripe processor tests - payment_intent, invoice, subscription events, membership logic
T4.3: Shopify processor tests - orders/create, orders/updated, app/uninstalled, customer matching
T4.4: GoCardless processor tests - payments, subscriptions, mandates, membership status
T4.5: Future Ticketing processor tests - ticket events, customer matching, stadium entry
T4.6: Mailchimp processor tests - click events, email lookup, tag updates

T5.title: Integration Client Tests
T5.description: Create tests for external API integration clients (Shopify, Stripe, GoCardless, Future Ticketing, Mailchimp) against sandbox/test APIs or with HTTP mocking at the boundary level.
acceptance_criteria: stripe.client.integration.test.ts - API client methods, error handling, retry logic, rate limiting
shopify.client.integration.test.ts - order fetch, customer lookup, product queries
gocardless.client.integration.test.ts - payment retrieval, subscription details, mandate info
futureticketing.client.integration.test.ts - ticket list, customer data, events
mailchimp.client.integration.test.ts - member lookup, tag operations, campaign clicks
Tests either use sandbox APIs or MSW (Mock Service Worker) for HTTP mocking at boundary
Detailed logging of all HTTP requests/responses with headers and bodies
Error scenario coverage: timeouts, 500 errors, rate limits, malformed responses
subtasks: T5.1: Set up MSW (Mock Service Worker) for HTTP mocking or configure sandbox API credentials
T5.2: Stripe client tests - retrievePayment, retrieveInvoice, retrieveSubscription, listSubscriptions, errors
T5.3: Shopify client tests - getOrders, getCustomer, getProducts, search API, pagination
T5.4: GoCardless client tests - getPayment, getSubscription, listMandates, rate limiting handling
T5.5: Future Ticketing client tests - getTickets, getCustomer, getEvents, authentication
T5.6: Mailchimp client tests - getMember, addTag, removeTag, getCampaignClicks, batch operations

I1.title: E2E Flow: Webhook to Database
I1.description: End-to-end integration test simulating complete webhook flow: external system → webhook handler → S3 → SQS → processor → database. Verify data integrity with detailed logging.
acceptance_criteria: Full webhook flow tests for each provider (Stripe, Shopify, GoCardless, Mailchimp)
Tests run complete flow: HTTP webhook → handler → queue → processor → DB
Verify S3 payload storage with correct metadata
Verify SQS message structure and attributes
Verify database state after processing (supporter, events, memberships, email_aliases)
Logging at each step with trace ID for correlation
Test failure scenarios and recovery (DLQ, retry, rollback)
subtasks: I1.1: Create e2e/tests/webhook-flow.ts with test orchestrator that spins up LocalStack and test DB
I1.2: Stripe webhook flow test - payment webhook → processor → membership created → event stored → supporter created/updated
I1.3: Shopify webhook flow test - order webhook → processor → supporter matched → order event stored
I1.4: GoCardless webhook flow test - payment webhook → processor → membership updated → payment event stored
I1.5: Future Ticketing webhook flow test - ticket webhook → processor → supporter matched → ticket event stored
I1.6: Mailchimp webhook flow test - click webhook → processor → email matched → click event stored

I2.title: E2E Flow: API Request to Response
I2.description: End-to-end integration tests simulating real API Gateway requests through to database response. Verify complete request/response cycle with detailed logging.
acceptance_criteria: Search API e2e tests - various queries, filters, pagination, empty results, error cases
Profile API e2e tests - valid supporter, not found, data aggregation, linked accounts, timeline
Timeline API e2e tests - filtering, pagination, date ranges, metadata, empty timeline
Merge API e2e tests - valid merge, self-merge prevention, conflict detection, audit logging
Auth middleware integration - valid/invalid tokens, role checks, path matching
Request/response logging with trace IDs for debugging
Performance tests - measure response times for various query types
subtasks: I2.1: Create e2e/tests/api-flow.ts with Lambda invocation simulator and API Gateway event builder
I2.2: Search API e2e tests - name search, email search, phone search, combined filters, pagination, no results
I2.3: Profile API e2e tests - full profile with timeline, overview cards, membership details, linked IDs, flags
I2.4: Timeline API e2e tests - all events, filtered by type, date range, pagination, metadata expansion
I2.5: Merge API e2e tests - successful merge, self-merge rejection, conflicting data, audit log verification, DB state check

I3.title: E2E Flow: Multi-System Supporter Journey
I3.description: Complex end-to-end tests simulating realistic supporter journeys across multiple systems. Verify data aggregation and timeline building with detailed logging.
acceptance_criteria: Journey 1: New supporter (Shopify) → Future Ticketing ticket purchase → membership signup → full profile
Journey 2: Existing supporter (Stripe) → ticket purchase → membership upgrade → timeline verification
Journey 3: Multi-channel supporter (Shopify + Future Ticketing) → email merge conflict → merge operation
Journey 4: Season ticket holder with Mailchimp engagement → complete profile with tags
Each journey test creates realistic test data, processes through multiple systems, verifies final state
Timeline verification - all events in correct order with proper metadata
Supporter type classification verification
Detailed logging at each step with journey ID for traceability
subtasks: I3.1: Create e2e/tests/supporter-journey.ts with journey orchestrator and test data generators
I3.2: Journey 1 - New shop customer: Shopify order webhook → supporter created → Future Ticketing ticket → membership signup
I3.3: Journey 2 - Stripe member: Stripe payment → Future Ticketing ticket → membership upgrade → verify timeline
I3.4: Journey 3 - Merge scenario: create two supporters, add Shopify to one, ticket to other, merge, verify consolidated data
I3.5: Journey 4 - Multi-channel: Shopify orders + Future Ticketing tickets + Mailchimp clicks → full profile verification

E1.title: Frontend Component Unit Tests
E1.description: Create React Testing Library tests for all frontend components. Test user interactions, form handling, data fetching, and error states with detailed logging.
acceptance_criteria: Search page tests - search input, debounce, filters, results display, loading states, empty states
Profile page tests - header display, overview cards, tabs switching, timeline component, error states
Admin/Merge page tests - search functionality, supporter selection, merge modal, validation, success/error
Timeline component tests - event rendering, filter chips, date grouping, load more, empty state
API hooks tests - useSearch, useSupporterProfile, useSupporterTimeline, useMergeSupporters
100% component coverage with React Testing Library
No snapshot tests (prefer behavior verification)
Accessibility tests (jest-axe or similar)
subtasks: E1.1: Setup Vitest + React Testing Library + Testing Library Jest DOM in frontend
E1.2: Create test/setup/test-utils.ts with custom renderers, mock wrappers, query helpers
E1.3: Search page tests - search input, filters, results table, pagination, keyboard navigation
E1.4: Profile page tests - header cards, tab navigation, timeline component, back button, refresh
E1.5: Admin merge tests - search inputs, supporter cards, merge modal, validation, success/error states
E1.6: Timeline component tests - event cards, filter toggles, date headers, load more, empty state, error handling

E2.title: Frontend E2E Tests with Playwright
E2.description: Create Playwright end-to-end tests for critical user flows. Tests run against local or staged backend, with detailed logging and trace capture.
acceptance_criteria: Playwright config with local/staged environment switching
Flow 1: Search → Select supporter → View profile → Navigate timeline → Return to search
Flow 2: Search → Apply filters → Clear filters → Verify results update
Flow 3: Admin page → Search supporters → Select two → Merge → Verify success
Flow 4: Direct profile URL → View profile → Check all tabs → Verify timeline loads
Flow 5: Search with no results → Verify empty state, try different filters
Network request/response logging with trace IDs
Screenshot capture on failure, video recording option
subtasks: E2.1: Install and configure Playwright in frontend package
E2.2: Create playwright.config.ts with baseURL configuration, tracing, screenshot options
E2.3: Create tests/e2e/search.spec.ts - search flow, filter interactions, result selection
E2.4: Create tests/e2e/profile.spec.ts - profile navigation, tab switching, timeline pagination
E2.5: Create tests/e2e/admin-merge.spec.ts - admin flow, supporter selection, merge modal, success confirmation
E2.6: Create test helpers for authentication, API mocking (if needed), common page interactions

E3.title: CI/CD Test Integration
E3.description: Integrate all tests into CI/CD pipeline with parallel execution, test reporting, and failure notifications. Ensure tests run on every PR and merge.
acceptance_criteria: GitHub Actions or equivalent CI workflow
Parallel test execution for speed
Test reporting dashboard (coverage, trends, flaky test detection)
Slack/email notifications for test failures
E2E tests run on merge to main (not every PR for speed)
Unit and integration tests run on every PR
Coverage reporting with minimum thresholds enforced
Test infrastructure startup/stop scripts for CI environment
subtasks: E3.1: Create .github/workflows/test.yml with unit, integration, and e2e test jobs
E3.2: Configure parallel test execution with proper test database isolation
E3.3: Set up coverage reporting (Codecov or similar) with PR comments
E3.4: Configure test result reporting with status badges
E3.5: Set up notification system for failures (Slack/webhook)
E3.6: Add test infrastructure health check to CI pipeline
